name: W Chicago - City Center

reviews.title: Funky, Funky, Funky!
reviews.text: Neat hotel in the heart of the financial district. Very close to all of the subway/ elevated lines so transportation is a breeze. Hotel is funky with candles lit all over the lobby and modern but comfortable furnishings. Service was first rate. Concierge staff are excellent! They will handle any question or reservation problem immediately. Make sure you ask for the AAA rate, I saved $200 per night. 24 hour room service and great food in the restaurant. You'll like it.

reviews.title: What a great hotel!
reviews.text: We were pick pocketed while exiting the subway in Chicago. We don't carry much cash but our credit cards were gone also. The folks at the W were fantastic. They cashed our check which had been nixed by telecheck because it was drawn on the account from which the credit card had been stolen. They sent complimentary fruit, cheese and wine to our room. Everyone there was so accomodating and kind.
Beside all this, the room was beautiful and the bedding was so comfortable! We WILL return to the W on Adams in Chicago.
reviews.title: If you want a W in Chicago - choose the Lakeshore! or even better - the Sofitel!
Poor
reviews.text: After having a great stay at the W Lakeshore, we thought we'd give the W City Center a try. BIG MISTAKE! We booked a room with a king bed in the 'Mega' category. We received a Starwood Gold upgrade to an 'Alternative' suite (Room 1201) which had a Queen bed. When I called the welcome desk to enquire if they had any other suites with a King, I was told that they were too busy to speak with me - and they would call me back. 10 minutes later, I was told that ALL of their suites have King beds - and that their engineering dept. must have changed the bed in our room without informing them. (Which sounded a bit like a lie - the bedroom could not accommodate a king bed). We waited another 15 minutes for an 'Ambassador' to come up to our room with keys to another suite (room 601) which had a King bed - but this 'suite' was considerably smaller. (What the W calls a suite at this location is really just two small connecting hotel rooms). It was apparent that our new room hadn't been used in a while - everything was covered in a layer of dust - including the mirror in the parlour room - which someone hand written 'Clean Me' in the dust. We decided to make the best of it and unpacked. The ice machine on the 6th floor was broken, so I had to climb the stairs in search of a working machine. I know that W thinks their dark corridors are 'cool', but when I was wandering the halls looking for an ice machine, I felt unsafe - if their was a fire, how would you be able to see at all? The next morning I was awakened to sound of guest room doors being repeatedly opened and slammed shut. After counting 10 loud door 'SLAMS' - I went out to the hall to see who was doing this - SURPRISE! it was housekeeping! I asked her to to be more courteous - as some people are still sleeping - and she just stared at me - no apology. We decided that we would be happier if we moved to the W Lakeshore - and called downstairs to ask if they could make the arrangements. I was again told that they were too busy to speak with me - and they would call me back. When they did call back - I was told that our rate would not be honoured at the W Lakeshore, nor would we receive an upgrade there. If we wanted a suite at the W Lakeshore it was 750.00 per night. At that point we decided that we were moving to the Sofitel and checked out. Our bill was wrong - double charged for Internet and not billed for parking. They even tried to charge us an 'early check out fee' which they graciously waived. Would NEVER return.

For such a hyped hotel, my stay was really very disappointing. Stuck in an end room, with a view of the neighbouring roof that was completely uninspiring. Staff seemed disinterested and the queue to check out was enormous! The W Lakeshore is 10 times better than this one.
reviews.title: Good if you get the right room

reviews.text: The lobby was truly dazzling with the feel of an upscale night club more so than a hotel. I was fortunate enough to snag a "Spectacular" king room...more than enough space for one person...room was very clean and the decor pretty much matches the photos on the website. Loved the extra touches like the cordless phone, cd and dvd player, huge fluffy towels and bathrobe complimented with Bliss Spa products! The highlight for me was the bed...comfortable doesn't even begin to describe! The staff were attentive and very friendly. The only negative was the quality of the food versus the cost of room service (12% service charge tacked on, not including tip). I guess that's to be expected with any 4 star hotel. I would definitely stay here again but would avoid room service.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel!
Very Nice Once I Complained
reviews.text: My driver from the airport told me that the rooms on floors 8 and below are much smaller because that is where the original building was. My room on the eighth floor would have been ok except for the constant industrial noises coming from the street. Get a room higher up if you don't want to hear the city late at night. I moved to the 14th floor and it was much quieter.
Stay in a superior room if you can it is very roomy and very comfortable. Nicely decorated too.
reviews.title: Very Hip!

reviews.text: Beautiful and stylish lobby but the non-stop throbbing music does not make for a relaxing atmosphere. Most areas in the hotel, hallways and lobby are lighted by blue lights or candle light which makes everything very dark and made me feel like I was in hiding. You might feel that this makes you dangerous and mysterious so it could be a good thing.
reviews.title: Pretentiously hip

reviews.text: Fantasitc location for seeing Chicago and there are some great restaurants within walking distance. The food at the hotel was very good too. The staff were all bending over backwards to help the guests so I would recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: The bed was like sleeping on a cloud!
Nice W
reviews.text: I stayed in the W - City Center March 16-18. The hotel is overall very good. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Check-in was a snap as was check out. The Lobby is a scene! Being from New York, I am used to this type of thing, but you could tell some of the midwesterners were a little out of place. If you are not looking for a trendy hotel, the W is not for you. But, if you are in the under 35 crowd looking for a little swank...this is the place in Chicago. I will be back soon!

reviews.title: Funkiest Place I've stayed in....
reviews.text: Funkiest hotel I've stayed in. Lots of attitude, great lobby bar. Top of the hotel bar is overpriced though the people working there "beautiful". I swear the elevator is pumped with a scent, and the funky music makes it feel like you're at a party - even at 7AM when you're on the elevator with a hangover.

reviews.title: W Hotels make for a great trip
reviews.text: Room service and the hotel restaurant are pricey. Lots of better options around Chicago (try the Chicago Chop House).

reviews.title: Great for business travelers!
reviews.text: Service at the door was inconsistent. Sometimes they opened the door for you, sometimes they did not. We also had hundreds of dollars in odd billings on our statement that had to be removed (be sure to double check your bill and dispute anything). Fortunately, the extra charges were removed without hassle.
As well, I lost the access card to my hotel room and they provided me with a new one without any problems - though I had to produce picture ID.
reviews.title: Just Our Style
Very hip, however...
reviews.text: I just stayed in this hotel a few days ago for a four-nights stay. I must admit that I love Starwood and the promotions they have. However, this time due to a lack in time I booked last minute and got a rate of 255$ per night, but got the fourth night free. When arriving at the hotel I was very impressed by the lobby. The hotel is very dark, which feels like a nightclub even during the morning. Its focused towards young and hip people as well as businessmen, due to its location in the finance district. But, it is very far from everything else, including shopping on Magniicient Mile. We got two rooms for four adults and a child. The rooms were so tiny you couldnt fit anything and we requested for two double beds. It took us a long negotiation to rearrange accomodation and we got a "superior" room instead which is much nicer and is also very trendy. I loved the room, the bed is sooo confortable. However the W lacked some basic luxury service such as cleaning of dorrway ( some people left food for a whole day wuthout it being cleaned). furthermore there was no pool which is annoying when you have kids. Everything you see in the room is beautiful, but you have to pay a lot of money if you want to keep it or use it, such as a large bottle of water next to the bed which costs 8$!!!!!

reviews.title: Ok concept, but the stafff.
reviews.text: Overall though, the hotel is very well designed and even though the staff wasnt very friendly I thought that the rooms and the general trendy atmosphere gave this hotel something to talk about.

The staff, basically the outdoor staff, need to learn some manners. I have seen these people give guests, and even people walking down the street (it is on a busy street heavy with foot traffic), rude hand gestures and laugh.
reviews.title: Wonderful beds and rooms

reviews.text: If you want people to stay at your hotel, and least treat them with respect, or quit if you don't like (or know how to do) your job.
reviews.title: Excells in some important areas, average in others
W's miss
reviews.text: I would never stay here again.

description: Welcome to that toddlin' town. Set in the middle of the famed Chicago Loop, W Chicago - City Center is close to the Willis Tower, the Chicago Art Institute, Millennium Park, and the theater district.
